text: This used to be a good company before they start offering the repairmen commission when they sold an AC unit.  My family and I used this company for years. The last time someone came out, they put freon in my unit and said I needed a new unit because the leak was coming from within.  I called another guy who looked at the unit and said you have a leak in a hose outside.  He could tell because leaves and dirt had settled in the spot where the hole was. He fixed in about 10 minutes and havent had a problem since.  The time before that, someone came out, and didnt bother to look at anything, and said they could get me a new unit and they would have it built on a concrete block to make it nice.  I called someone else and it was the fan motor. Offering your employees commission has really prompted your employees to become scam artist, thus making your company look bad.

First time home owner here who should have listened to her father the first time he suggested Head's. Actually called a different HVAV company initially. That tech said a clogged drain line was the issue. It wasn't. Head's came out and actually listened to my husband and I about the problem, then proceeded to run his own diagnostics and handle the repair needed.

Not a clogged drain but a bad module.

The tech was friendly, very knowledgeable, and I thoroughly appreciated him explaining to me what the issue was.

Thank you Head's for your time and professionalism. My family will only use your service in the future.

name: deb c
text: I realize some people had an experience quite different from mine, but my recent experience with Head's was quite good. I would give them 4 3/4 stars if that were an option. I recently bought a house in Mobile, and was given paper work showing the AC coils having been replaced in January 2018 by Head's, with a 10 year guarantee. On some of the 1st hot days this year, the AC did not seem to be cooling efficiently, and there was quite a lot of condensation and then ice on the lines. I called Head's with some reluctance due to the negative reviews, but they were extremely responsive, came out to the house in less than 2 hours, and were extremely thorough, professional, courteous, and pleasant. They diagnosed the problem, handled it, and then checked everything else, and explained exactly what was going on.  They even gave me a call the next day to make certain everything went well. The only reason I'd take of 1/4 star would be because there was some initial record keeping confusion, and the problem with the AC function was traced back to a cap which should not have been added/placed at the previous service due to the slightly unusual configuration of my particular AC and furnace. Luckily, the tech (Scott) was very knowledgeable and diagnosed it easily.

resp.text: We are very grateful of your review and are glad that we were able to properly diagnose and fix your problem!!

name: Theodore Chandler
text:
Fails to deliver. Possibility of being ghosted.

TLDR:
Request patch on back porch to prevent further floor joist damage
Company patches hole but it fails to seal against water leaks
Request company come back to fix patch
Company fails to deliver. Instead stops all contact with customer.

I accepted a proposal to repair a leak on my back porch and fix a floor joist which had been rotting due to the leak.
Work took place on February 20th while I was out of town. The floor joist was successfully repaired. Unfortunately when I got back and poured some water over the patch I found that it still allowed water onto the support.
I contacted the business owner (Devin Lanier) on February 25 by text message and by email on February 27th.
The business owner replied via email the next day stating "So sorry about that. Let me look at our schedule and I will get someone back out there to check it out ASAP".
The company scheduled an appointment for Sunday March 3rd to look at the leak. A storm came through the area on the day they were scheduled and I understand it would not have been possible for them to come out. Unfortunately no cancellation notice was communicated to me.
I reached back out by email on March 4th to ask again for someone to check on the leak and I was told "Yes a few of my guys were caught up up with the weather. Let me look at our schedule this week and try to get someone to cut loose and head over there. I’ll let you know. "

Since the email on the March 4th I have not received any contact from the company. I have tried many avenues of contact without success.
Including emails on March 9th, March 14th, March 18th and March 28th.
Phone calls to both the main number requesting call backs and the estimator number. None of which have been returned

name: Jason Polancich
text: Another example of an unreliable local Tuscaloosa home improvement company. Had them out week before Thanksgiving for a quote to replace/repair gutters on a historic home in downtown Tuscaloosa. Was told Id have a quote out by the next week and they'd be able to start within a couple weeks. Two weeks went by and no quote. I called them, was transferred to a rep named Mike "who handles all the gutters." He told me he'd follow back up with me by the afternoon. Now, first week of January, called back and got mike who said "We're not going to be able to help you on that job." Im guessing it was too low a cost threshold for them, but it would have been very nice to have known that back in November. Great people. Don't advertise gutter repair/replacement if you dont actually do the work!

I could have not been more pleased with their quality of work and professionalism. These technicians really take a lot of pride in their work and it shows. This product has about half inch insulation rigid backing that makes it more solid. Looks like actual wood when driving up to the house. It matches other wooden board and batten we have on front of our house. I was tired of painting and replacing weather worn boards. We ordered color that matches the paint we have on the house. No more on ladder for me on this particular wall of the house. Once again i do recommend Isbell. Really nice technicians that do a great job. As other time price i believe was real reasonable.

name: Carrie Walker
text:
I recieved a grant for insulation and these were the guys who came to do it. There is a lot to tell so maybe i can get through it all.
One of the guys made rude and unnecessary comments to my underage daughter, another walked in the bathroom on her and didnt knock. Those are enough to leave a bad review,  but let's get to the actual work.
They told me I didnt hve to move anything, but sprayed insulation lll over my bed, furniture, and all of my clothing, not once but 3 days in a row.
They cut through a water pipe in my upstairs (when they cut holes in the floor to insulate the layer between the up and downstairs) and they just capped it off leaving no running water to the upstairs kitchen or bathroom. They threw about a gallon size jug of nails all over my driveway which I found with 3 tires that I had to replace.
They were supposed to put storm windows on, caulk, and seal all air leaks. Instead of storm windows in several locations, they screwed plexiglass over the whole thing which happens to be a fire hazard, not to mention unsafe if my daughter ever has to get out of her window in an emergency. They also cut the power to one of the plugs in my kitchen and never fixed it either.
I never knew what was happening because there was a lack of communication between the office, the crew, and myself. Oh, they were supposed to come back and install a new backdoor but they never did that either, and I'm okay with that considering everything they messed up and didnt fix.

name: Taylor H
text: One of the worst companies I have ever dealt with. House was termite bonded through Sprays when I purchased. The technician came out a couple of times, inspected the house, presented paper work, took credit card information, and said he would take care of the rest with the office. One year later I never heard about paying the renewal few which was ~$200. Well come to find out the technician never turned in the paper work, left the company, and my house was no longer bonded so they wanted me to pay $1,000+ and a new yearly fee. Spoke with MR. SPRAY himself who said he would make it right, but instead gave me a bunch of sales garbage and how he really is a good guy blah blah blah. HE STILL WANTED THE $1000+. What a con company, even if one of the other places charge a little higher for the yearly fees it is 100% worth the money.

name: Elena Johnson
text:
March of this year we hired MDH Construction to do a foundation repair job of one of our homes. With genuine sincerity we would rate this company,  under the leadership of its owner, Mike Hayes, as "Best in Class". The group is made up of dedicated professionals and highly skilled individual driven by high quality service comittment.
The repair MDH was hired to do was one that had been previously attempted by another foundation repair company. This was our second time addressing the same problem. While the first company ensured us the fix we paid for was permanent. It was short number of years later that we began seeing signs indicating the repair was failing . We found ourselves back at square one.
At the time we did not know MDH Foundation. We did reach out to the only other company we knew of thru advertisement only, and while we had someone come out assess and quote us a price, we chose to hold off. Very impressive sales presentation they did but we were just not convinced on their proposed corrective plan.  Some time later we hear of MDH, and a lot of good things being said of the owner, Mike Hayes. Not only on their foundation repair work, but as a very highly respectable contractor too.  Earlier this year we met with a member of the MDH team, and an assessment was made. Then before the job plan was finalized, the owner, Mike, came out to thoroughly go over the plan. It was the first time we felt really comfortable about the corrective plan.  Mike has a great group of professionals and skill guys that communicate well together. They were very attentive to our concerns, explained and answered every question.  They were punctual and respective of time. Always leaving area neat after each day.  We only wish we would have found MDH Foundation Repair the first time around.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. It was a pleasure working for you! :-)

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Collins!

name: Colleen Wilger
text: If I could give this company a zero I would.  Please stay far away if you want an honest assessment and accountability. I will explain the events and you can judge for yourself.  The experience started off quite well, Christian was quick to come out for a consult, where he made the assessment that flying squirrels were the cause of our attic sound.  He then proceeded to hand my husband a contract for $2400 without explaining charges.  My husband questioned the cost and he quickly removed the multi year warranty which lowered the price to $1400. He was then told it would be a week before any exclusion work would be done.  He agreed and waited. The company placed barriers on roof and a one way door to allow squirrels to leave on their own (work happened on a Tuesday).  So we waited some more.  The next Monday.  A week later we were still continuing to hear the SAME noise.  I called the company (twice) before someone named Greg came out to do a check.  He only checked the roof and not the interior of the attic where the sound was, said everything looked good and was working correctly.  We voiced our concerns and he said sometimes they take 3 weeks to leave but that there is a possibility that since the excrement looks similar it could be mice instead but if that was the case it would require a different company. He said they could set traps but would just wait until the follow up the following week. Mind you the amount you pay up front is not refundable AT ALL. so that Monday night once again we hear the noise (2 weeks into the process now and the sound is right above the master bedroom so two weeks with no sleep).  The next day I go to Home Depot and get traps myself.  Place the traps after work (about 7pm) and by 10 pm the have a heart had caught something! But to our surprise.  It was not a squirrel but a mouse.  We release it the next day and reset the trap as well as two old school back cracker style traps, the next morning we’ve caught another.  Still no squirrels.  I call the company obviously irritated (once again takes two calls to get a call back). Greg calls back and is super defensive won’t admit there is a chance that they did not assess the full situation correctly (house was built in the 70’s so sure maybe there was a chance there was old poop up there from something else).  Once again extremely defensive, belittling, opposite of good customer service.  Says he is the boss there is no one above him to discuss my concerns with.  They are currently still supposed to come do a recheck and spray some sort of an enzyme mix to stop squirrels from coming back (that we’ve already paid for at this point) but if Squirrels were not the problem what good is that?? I think even an admission that the initial assessment could have been wrong would have gone a long way but no.  they basically said there is no way to prove that squirrels didn’t leave...even though the sound is still present so the situation is obviously not resolved oh and the icing on the cake, the company does not trap mice.  If your in the Vestavia, AL area please pick a different company if you don’t know for sure the specific animal you have a problem with because this company will be honest upfront.  If Christian had told my husband..look here is what I think but there is a chance 50/50, 75/25 whatever you want to call it that this won’t work to solve your problem because you may have a different problem or two problems...then we would be looking at a different review.  I’m not unreasonable I just expect accountability.  I still have a phone call in to someone at a higher level at the company hoping for some answers  or resolution before taking further action but my hopes are not high.   Best thing I can do is to warn my fellow neighbors and friends.

resp.text:
Mrs. Wilger,

We appreciate your review although there needs to be some clarification. Your attic did have signs of squirrels. We do not make guarantees that wildlife will be removed within a specific time period and your complaints about still hearing noises happened while we were not yet entirely completed with the service. Wildlife are unpredictable and one week is not enough time to know if our service is working or not. We completed all of the repairs per the schedule and we have to let our systems run their course. Thank you again for your business and we look forward to resolving your issue.

name: Keekay Lomo
text:
Please stay away from this
company. They damaged my celing during an inspection and still have not fixed it. They had us pay for the squirrel removal and seal and 2weeks later they still haven't shown up to do the job.

Response from the owner a day ago

Mrs. Akinsanya, The job was scheduled for 9/24/19 as agreed upon when the contract was executed. All work was completed then. As soon as we found out about the damaged ceiling, we informed you that we would get that fixed as soon as we know all of the squirrels have been removed to decrease the risk of live squirrels getting into into the living space of the house. We greatly appreciate the opportunity to serve you.

I'm sorry but you have the wrong information. When Richard came to our home on 9/6/19 to pick up the check and contract he said we would receive a call on 9/9/19 to schedule because the service had to be paid in advance before the job could be scheduled. Which we never did receive a call so my husband called on Tuesday and we were scheduled for 9/19/19 between 8-1. We tried to cancel because that seemed too far out to allow the squirrel to remain in our home to keep causing damage, but we were quickly reminded of the No Refund Policy. At 12:30 on 9/19 we received a call saying no one would be able to come do the job that day because of a delay in his schedule (eventhough we had rearranged our schedule to make sure someone would be at home) and that he had to come on Sunday morning 9/22/19.
You may want to retrain your staff to give complete information upfront   and double check your information before responding.
Thank you!

Update: It's September 2020 and they won't answer our calls and still have not fixed our ceiling!
Stay away from these scammers!

resp.text:
Mrs. Akinsanya,

The job was scheduled for 9/24/19 as agreed upon when the contract was executed. All work was completed then.

As soon as we found out about the damaged ceiling, we informed you that we would get that fixed as soon as we know all of the squirrels have been removed to decrease the risk of live squirrels getting into into the living space of the house.

We greatly appreciate the opportunity to serve you.

Thank You

name: Ludmila Williams
text: This is my first negative review and I hate having to do it but I contacted these people because of all the good reviews. I have 2 townhomes, a little Bat had started visiting one of my porches, we tried everything and the little thing kept coming back. I called Conserv and asked if they could do anything to get rid of the bat, they said they would have someone call me to come out. Daxton called and came out a few days later, my husband met him and Daxton recommend to have both homes sprayed so we did. It cost $189, which we were good with if it meant the Bat would leave. The next day a different Bat showed up so my husband called Daxton directly (which he said we could do) and he said he would come out and see. Never heard from him again. My husband and I have call every week since July 3rd and every time we get “I’ll get someone to call you back”. I was not looking for a refund AT ALL I just want the Bats gone. Ever since we had the houses sprayed we now have 2 different bats that come every night. I just wish they would be honest with me and say there is nothing they can do instead of giving me the run around. Pretty disappointed with my experience. I guess I will stop trying at this point and just count my losses.

resp.text:
Good Afternoon Mrs. Ludmila,

We really appreciate the review.

We took a deep look into our phone records and your account information and here is what we found.

Phone records show Greg did return your calls. There wasn’t a single call that went unreturned. We are not sure what the confusion was here, but am deeply sorry for any miscommunication.

Service agreements you signed indicate you purchased a one time deterrent application to the exterior of your home to deter the bat that was showing itself on the exterior. The service clarified that there is no guarantee because the bat can’t legally be relocated and we can’t control a bat flying outside or landing on your home on the outside. Because the bat was only on the outside of the house and did not enter the structure, there is nothing more that can be done to deter the bat.

We would be happy to come by to take a second look at no charge.

Thank You,

Management

name: Ryan Baldwin
text:
I contacted the company in late May to help with a squirrel issue. The Tech arrived and found the entry point that the squirrel was using to get in the attic. I was then informed that they could put up something to allow the squirrels to get out, but not get back in. I agreed to their charge of $399 to perform the service and the tech said that he would be back the following week to complete the task.

On the following Wednesday, I received a message that the tech had been let go from the company and to call the office to reschedule the appointment. I called back and they were unable to send anyone out to complete the task in a reasonable time frame, so I informed them to refund my money and I would handle the issue myself. I was informed that they could not issue a refund, so I asked to speak to a manager.

The following day, I spoke to Rick(VP of Ops) and was informed that I should have my refund in the next couple days. I checked a week later and still no refund. I then called Rick back and he apologized and told me that he would ensure the refund was made and would be in my account in the next few days. Again, no refund after a week. I then called Rick again and received no answer, so I followed up with the office(Birmingham) and was told that Rick was no longer with the company. Surprise, Surprise.

Fast forward, I've spoken to multiple people about the refund and they have sworn that I will be getting it. I hate to say that it has now been 3 months since my first scheduled appointment with this company and still nothing has been done to resolve my issue.

If I were you, I'd look for someone else to do your wildlife removal.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Update-9/9/2018

Even though the owner has commented that a refund was processed, it is over a week later and there is still no refund.

Kyle-Where is my refund?

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Update-9/13/2018

Got my refund.

resp.text:
Mr. Baldwin,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We are very sorry that your experience was not pleasant. A refund has been sent for processing.

Sincerely,

Kyle Waltz, President

name: Mary Ann Meadows
text: This company practices fraud!  Don’t walk!  RUN!  They are deceptive and charge for no work.  Said my attic had bats and gables needed retired.  The honest company showed me my gables were clean and screening was in perfect condition.  This company told me they would find my check I had given the tech that didn’t show up for the work and would call me back.  Instead they cashed check for doing absolutely zero work!

resp.text:
Mrs. Meadows,

First off, I want to thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. Reviews help us improve. We looked into your situation and found the following; our former branch manager was the one who sold this work to you. At that time, he was filling in for a vacant position and was doing 2 jobs. He was very good at his job. It seems that he never scheduled for your work to be completed. We are very sorry for any inconveniences and will be happy to provide you with a refund for any in-completed work. Thank You and we are sorry for any inconveniences. As far as him charging you for things you do not need, we do not condone that type of behavior and we appreciate you bringing that to our attention. Since he is no longer an employee, we will not be addressing that with him but will certainly bring that up in our morning meeting tomorrow.

Sincerely,

Kyle Waltz, President

name: John Schueth

name: Firas Nasr
text: I found a blind rakoon at my property so I called them to report this and hoping they could provide a help for the poor rakoon, but what the lady over the phone did is that she took my number and name and never heard from them :/ why the hell would you take my contact info and leave the poor rakoon blind and exposed to injuries or even death ? Nobody came to me or heard from them again. Don't call them they will not do any help for the poor animals.

resp.text:
Mr. Nasr,

I'm very sorry to hear about your experience. We do not handle any animal rescue, only nuisance wildlife removal. Your information was sent to an animal rescue agency for assistance and they should've contacted you. If you are ever in need of animal rescue, please contact the department of natural resources.

Thank You,

Kyle Waltz, President

name: Maranda Duchock
text:
I have read the reviews left here and am a little wary but so far pleased. Kyle came out the same day I called and helped identify entry points for mice and bats and scheduled someone to come out the next day to repair those exclusions. He was thorough, patient, and had good advice regarding our recent flea issue despite that not being within their offering. The price was a little higher than expected but seemed to cover all of our concerns. I will update with more to say when exclusions are fixed.

Update: repairs were made the day after our initial appointment, then someone came out to follow up a week or 2 after, and we've been checked in on via phone as well! Dedicated service and our concerns or additional issues were noted and covered under warranty so I feel our home is in good hands.

name: Charity Laister
text:
DONT USE THIS COMPANY! This company is a nightmare. I paid them a hefty sum up front to provide pest control and repair my home. I have waited five months with no assistance.

1. The first day of services they failed to show after making an appointment with me. I had taken a day off of work and reiterated this so they finally sent a guy named Kyle who took my payment and signed a contract with a bunch of promises they failed to fulfill.

2. Tech. Kyle scheduled a repairmen for the following week, but the tech never showed. Neither did the pest control worker.

3. I called conserv to alert them to these no shows, in response the pest control lady texted me in the middle of the week mid-day requesting to come to my house that day. (Like most ppl I couldn’t drop what i was doing).

4. The pest control worker texted me again and planned to visit the following week.

5. On the date of the visit, I again took off work, the pest control lady said she was too busy and couldn’t make it. We rescheduled.

6. On the next scheduled appointment she again couldn’t make it because she was “too busy”.

7. Finally, I put my foot down. Conserv scheduled an appointment for both workers. However, on the date of the repairmen appointment, I received a call that the repairmen stole the company truck and quit, but that they would get someone out as soon as possible.

8. Next, I received a text from the pest control lady saying she no longer worked there.

9. I eventually had someone come to the house and walk around. He promised that a repairmen would come soon.( this was in June).

10. To date (August), I have had no repairs. Mine you all of this started in March.

resp.text: Mrs. Laister, we are very sorry to hear that you have had a bad experience. I reviewed our records and found that we have been out to your home on multiple occasions to resolve your wildlife issue. I will have a manager contact you on Monday to schedule a visit and get everything resolved.

name: Megan Stones
text: I really felt like they cared about us and were willing to work with our hectic schedules for the appointments to check the traps.

Thank You

name: Melissa Mann
text: I wish I would have had the good experience that I see in the reviews. Unfortunately,I called this past Thursday, June 28th, and informed the lady over the phone that I came home to a 3-4 foot copperhead the night before that was headed towards my dogs fence ( dogs about 2 feet away from them). Panicked I called the police that night and they unfortunately pepper sprayed him or her making the snake angry... after chasing the cop, it ended up going through a vent on the side of my house. First, I was told a Kyle would contact me and three to four hours later after not hearing anything I called back and she told me a different name (cant remember the name) and she said he would contact me shortly . I never heard anything from either of them. I have been paranoid about the snake and really wanted an ease of mind to know it was removed from under my house OR to be told it was no longer there. I also told the lady that I was afraid it could have gotten through a crack under the house and went into my home. I notice that you reply to these reviews so if you look under my account from the contact it will be under Melissa Clements.

resp.text:
Mrs Clements,

We are so sorry to hear no one got back to you. I am not sure what happened. If you would like, we can arrange to come out and perform a free inspection to determine if there is any current snake activity. Please reach back out.

name: Claire Clune
text:
We were given a 5 week timeline for installation. After taking a half down payment ($3100) we haven’t heard back. After 7 weeks, my husband called a few times before they bothered to answer, saying they have no way of knowing when the windows will be done. It’s been 9.5 weeks now and no one will answer my calls or return them. I certainly understand delays are sometimes out of our control, but it is absolutely unacceptable that they are not staying in communication with us. A simple call with ‘so sorry, still in production!’ would go a long way here! I will absolutely not be recommending this company to anyone else. I welcome window depot to try to reply to this post; might be the only way I can get in communication with them. I will update if we ever hear back or get our windows installed.

UPDATE: Finally did receive a call back (After leaving messages last Wednesday and then again today) and they seemed more than a little peeved I expressed that I was unhappy with their lack of communication. Regardless of COVID as an excuse for slow production, communication of the delay should have been a given.

name: Joseph Carton
text: Ordered windows on 7/30/16, install date was 10/11/16. Windows came in with internal grids that were not even, screens missing or damaged, one window measured wrong, installers damaged tube in master bath, windows in living room came with no grid. As of 1/12/17, still waiting them to finished installation. Very hard to give a good rating based on this service they provided.

name: Dominique Ponder
text:
Wouldn't recommend anyone to use this company. We paid a deposit on our windows on June 1st, we were told it would be 8 to 10 weeks before they were installed. Called after 10 weeks  told the production company had delays. I had to call multiple times to find out this information. Never once did they call to inform me about any delay. So I waited another 4 weeks and called back. Got the same run around. Called back 2 to 3 weeks later and told them that they had a couple of days to figure something out or we would seek legal action. Miraculously a few days later they called with a confirmed ship date. The windows finally shipped and we had an appointment for install the next week. So TOTAL time from paying deposit to install was 19 weeks and 5 days.

After they installed the windows and my wife paid them, I get home from work to see trash in the driveway and the yard. I call Zach the owner and told him about the issue. Luckily they hadn't left town yet and were able to come back and clean up their mess.

name: Jason Hunter
text: I'm extremely glad that I chose Window Depot to replace my windows. The customer service from Bill  the salesman a retiree was an honest straight shooter. He did not try to sale you anything that you did not need. Zach the installer took really good measurements. He also explained in details how the windows would be installed and he answered all questions. Saving the best for last is Josh and Mike. The are the actually installers. Words cannot express about there workmanship. This is the best two man crew I have seen. They showed up on time ready to work. They did not take any lunch breaks except water breaks. They also explained the how's and why's of how they had to install the windows. On top of that Josh also fix my Doors from some previous installers. They are extremely detailed and the work can speak for itself. On a scale of 0-10 I would give them a 10 and recommend them. I will be calling them for future work if they can do it.

name: Kelly
text: We are very pleased with the windows we had installed by Window Depot. We were given lots of information and helpful advice on finding the perfect windows for our project. The installation crew was incredibly courteous and went above and beyond with getting a date set for our windows to go up .If you're rearching companies in the area for your next home project, no need to look further. Go with this company.

name: Pavlos Honderich
text:
I had 4 bids to install 16 total existing windows original to a 3 year old house.

We wanted to install 3 slider windows where we currently had a total of 4 single hung and 3 picture frames (2 sets of 2 and a set of 3 respectively).  The remainder of the single hungs would be replaced by double hungs and the 3 remaining picture frames would be replaced with picture frame windows.

Only Bill from Window Depot would listen to us and provided honest feedback some of which may have actually resulted them taking a few hundred dollars the less from us.  They also gave us an honest price since we went with our own financing.

It was the complete opposite than what we experienced with Champion who insisted on bells and whistles we didn't need or want and cost $2000 more for the same style and quality windows.  Champions sales pitch was also high stress (must sign today shtick to get special demo offer).

Window World had come recommended from a few friends but they insisted we go with double hung in all but the one picture frame over our bay window.  They insisted it would cost too much and wasn't worth it vs their recommendation for 15 double hung and 1 bay window.  Customer always knows best and Window World lost the job from the get go for that mistake.

The quality of the Window Depot installation job is also visibly much better compared to friends who have had Window World windows installed.

Bill in sales and Zach were great to work with.  Josh and his crew did an amazing job installing the windows.

name: Mike & Stephanie Freeman
text:
We first called the company “Critter Capture” and had them come out to get rid of a squirrel that had made his nest in our gutter. After checking our attic and seeing that the squirrel had not yet made an entrance into our house, they told us there was nothing they could do.  The guy didn’t even have a ladder to check our gutters!

So we call Jim from Exclusive Wildlife & Pest Control.  He laughed when I told him the previous encounter with the Critter Capture company and then proceeded to get his ladder (that he brought himself!) and take a look at our gutters and ensure that the squirrel had not damaged our roof yet and also took the time to double check our attic. No damage was noted except for the fire pit cover we caught the squirrel tearing up the previous weekend.

Jim gave me two options on how to get rid of our furry new houseguest; we could capture him alive and release him elsewhere or set a trap similar to a rat trap that should kill him instantly. After much discussion my husband and I decided on the rat trap since the evenings here have been very cold and the poor squirrel may freeze to death in a live trap. Jim was so very patient as we weighed our options and was able to give me the pros and cons on both methods.

After one failed attempt to trap him (the trap caught his tail instead of his neck) Jim text me throughout the evening to reassure me that he would get him the next day and that all would be OK. Jim returned promptly the next morning, set the trap again and was able to get the squirrel instantly. He disposed of everything and cleaned the nest out of the gutter.

Jim was so very pleasant to work with I will definitely be calling again if any other squirrel decides to make his home here!
I would recommend Jim and Exclusive Wildlife to anyone who is looking for good, quality, and prompt service.

Thank you Jim!

resp.text: Thank you Mike & Stephanie Freeman, it was my pleasure helping you rid your home of your unwelcomed guest and it was nice meeting you.

Brandon called ahead and arrived on time.  He asked if I had any questions and explained exactly what he would be doing.  The process took about 45 minutes and there was minimal cleanup he needed to do.

name: Betty Pierce
text:
Some years ago we needed some significant waterproofing and structural repairs done in our basement home. We contacted a few different companies to provide an Inspection and estimate. After some discussion we decided
On a company that was not on the higher side of the estimates. We felt like the fix would be pretty much the same no matter who we chose
And saving money was in our interest at the time..One company we called was a fairly well known local company A.F.S. We were familiar with them because they began here in Decatur
So we would see trucks around town. FYI,  I wanted you to know, we should’ve called AFS from the start. Today I’m here some 7 odd years later, after spending thousands of dollars with the low price alternative and my
Sump pump and drainage system doesn’t work, our walls are blistering and cracking up, down and horizontally, water is seeping thru the wall cracks and the concrete blocks are shifting and cracking our exterior brick and interior block walls. I have limited mobility and couldn’t go check on these things easily and things kept getting worse. Considering what we received from the lower priced company, we decided to call AFS to provide their opinion on our basement situation. At this point , the only thing working or effective was a dehumidifier. It was time to seek experts advice. We had previously used AFS in a limited capacity for our cracked pool deck and they performed that repair just fine and although that repair is not inexpensive,
It was much less and more quickly usable than any other options we looked at. So from there we felt we could allow them a chance to tell us (what )was happening and (why )was it happening . When the day came for the inspection, David Flamm , the inspector called our home in advance and let us know his arrival time and asked if we could sit for a few questions before beginning the inspection. He felt we would have something of value to help  determine the cause of the damage. We felt he was sincere and listened to what we had to say and even wrote down the answers. We watched as he went room to room with his big light and something like a laser . He was very thorough, and  took  pictures as he moved around the house.
One thing he did,  that most never do, is David removed his boots before walking on my clean floors. Not a big thing but it got my attention.
After the inspection inside , he explained what he would be doing outside and that my husband
Was welcome to tag along if he wanted, so he did. He was rather impressed with David’s knowledge and ability to explain the plan of repair. After our experience with another company (who did almost nothing) and David’s attitude and attention to our concerns, we were very relieved that we called AFS. He took pictures and put them on his laptop for us to clearly see the issues, he asked our opinion and waited for our response. Never did he act pushy or lacked any uncertainty about what he would do to help us. He allowed us to view video software of the repairs needed, and even priced the project as he went thru the videos. Needless to say,  we were very comfortable with Dave and could feel he really knew what the problems required. Before we had to ask, David explained AFS Warranty, Service and maintenance program and how they return and maintain the eguipment so we didn't have to worry. This was very helpful considering my physical limitations and my husband is very busy with work. We felt very reassured after spending a couple of hours with David Flamm, we had called the right company. AFS must invest a lot of time into the people that work for them, it was so smooth . We had no trouble connecting the dots. David explained the project review process they go they prior to arriving to our home and how the foreman on the job has already seen the project and all of the pictures as David and the foreman discuss the ins and outs of it. It seems every concern we had initially was addressed before we had to express it. AFS, should be the first and only call you make for your home today.
We are glad we did.

resp.text: Hello Betty! Thank you for taking time to submit a review about your experience with our company. We appreciate your thoughtful, detailed account of how we were able to deliver great results. We take tremendous care to provide the highest level of service possible during every project—and it’s awesome to be recognized for our efforts. - AFS Foundation & Waterproofing Specialists

name: Patricia Flory
text:
Nathan, Garrett and Alfonso showed up at the scheduled time to begin 5 days of work to install French drains, a sump pump and dehumidifier along with a full basement crawl space encapsulation at my house. They were very prompt and courteous.  We had a small problem that Nathan brought to my attention after he and his crew started the prep work in the area which resulted in them having to remove 2 additional (early 1930's) brick support columns and level the dirt foundation under them.  Had Nathan not brought the potential problem to my attention, even with the work they were doing, I might have had more collapse in that area in the future.  Now I won't have any concerns about that.  I was very impressed with how well these 3 men worked together and also independently while completing the job.  AFS has turned an old damp 1930's basement crawl space area into a bright, clean space my grandkids could play in at my house.  The crew cleanup in my yard was spot-on.  They even hauled off those brick columns for me.  I'm looking forward to the follow-up visit in about two months to see how much more lift they can get in my (had been) sagging floors.  There was some immediate improvement when they tightened all the floor jacks and after that new dehumidifier dries up my floor rafters for a few weeks we should see even more improvement.  No more squeaky, rattling floors!!
Thank you, AFS.
Patricia

resp.text: Ms. Flory, wow, thank you for such a thorough and kind review! We are glad you are happy with the work completed on your floors and crawl space as well! Let us know if we can be of any further assistance.

name: Patricia Blackman
text: My older home is on a crawl space that had become damp -- a real mess -- and I feared the foundation might have problems.  Ben Worsham inspected the crawl space and reassured me that the foundation itself was sound.  But he did find a leaking pipe and water damage to the subfloor.  He explained those issues, providing photos of the damage for me to submit to my insurance and to provide to the plumber and the restoration company that I called to fix those problems.  He was professional, thorough, helpful and responsive to my questions.  Later, the crawl space was sprayed with a cleaning/anti-mold agent and encapsulated efficiently by Josh Brazile and his crew (Victor C. and Rafael V.), who kept me posted on their progress and patiently answered my questions.  I recommend AFS!

name: Tom Counts
text:
I had a problem with the 20 year old concrete in my carport settling and cracking. It had to be stabilized or I was going to have to totally redo the carport.  I did not know who to contact but a friend had AFS do some foundation stabilization work for him. I asked him about AFS.  I had seen the TV ads but know that anyone can do a slick tv commercial.  It turns out, the friend was positively impressed with AFS on his project. So, I made an appointment for their rep to visit.  I was still a little skeptical.  The field rep arrived on time and looked at my issue.  He suggested their concrete stabilization product.  He described how it would work and be installed.  He was not at all pushy nor did he give me any slick sales pitch.  He knew about the product, how it was installed and what it could do.  I agreed to do the project with them and made a down payment on the project.  We scheduled the job and on the agreed upon day, the installation crew arrived.  They were a little later than initially planned BUT the office called to say they were running behind, so that was not an issue.  They were maybe 30 minutes later than planned. The installation guys checked over the carport and talked over their plans with me. Then they went straight to work. They were clean cut, totally nice people to have at my home with no smoking or foul language - just hard work! There was an obvious difference to the carport when they were through.  So, I really felt good about their work.  They also cleaned up any mess that they made (a little concrete dust) with the tools they brought to the job site. Prior to this experience, I did not know this company,  other than my from friends recommendation & a TV commercial.  After my experience I would not hesitate to recommend them.
I give AFS an A+ & 5 stars!

resp.text: Mr. Counts, thank you for such a thorough review and recommendation! We are glad you had a pleasant experience and that the repair to your carport was installed to your satisfaction. Let us know if we can be of any further assistance.

name: M Otto
text:
What a group of people and company!  I had a huge problem in my basement/crawlspace. Over the last 2 years, it has flooded during the heavy rains in January and February.  I did some research to evaluate this issue and decided to go with a reputable, established, and known company.  I was not disappointed.  Mr. David Flamm arrived at my house promptly for my initial appointment.  He was professional and personable.  After a few minutes of discussion, he understood my concerns and started his investigation.  Once he completed his investigation, he sat down my wife and I and went over his findings. His presentation of what could be done was easy to understand and follow along using the video clips on his computer. All seemed logical, but me, being the ever skeptic, asked many questions about how the system would work and why it seemed the water was infiltrating my living spaces after 7 years of no water. He answered all of my questions and his explanations made sense.  After it was all said and done, we had the Aquastop Control groundwater seepage system with Aquastop basement air system,  EZflow  tubing with the triple pump action installed.
Day of installation:
The team showed up on time for the install lead by Nick.  It had been raining a lot AGAIN and i had my makeshift sump-pump system running to dewater the area where it was building up.  The team laid down plastic tarp so as to not get my finished basement dirty and commenced to working.  It took them 2 days to complete.  What a job. When they laid in the pump system and started the pumps, the water buildup that i had my makeshift system in for, drained and did not come back.  EUREKA!!  Since this system has been in place, we continue to get the storms and flooding but my basement/crawlspace remain dry.  The system works as described and projected.  I cannot thank Dave and his team from AFS enough.  Their professionalism and concern to provide a solution to my problem was genuine and their work is top of the line. Dave's evaluation of my needs and his concern to present me with different options was genuine and without company profit in mind. I highly recommend this company and team for any issues you may have in basement or crawlspace area.  One happy customer...Mike Otto

resp.text: Mr. Otto, we are indeed pleased to hear that you are a happy customer! And, wow, thank you for sharing this with us. We are glad you had a great experience with Dave and that your basement/crawl space is dry now! Let us know if we can assist further - we'd be happy to.

name: Jeff Simmons
text:
I had mold and water seeping through my concrete block wall in basement. Due to hydrostatic pressure my walls were caving in slightly. I don’t remember the terminology  AFS uses but they came in and put what looks like a tarp over the walls.  It’s to prevent moisture and mold buildup. Life time warranty. It might be working but since my walls are covered up I am only guessing it is. After I removed everything from the walls in the basement, yes, everything, including taking out my bathroom, they jackhammered around the edge of the walls about a one foot trench. AFS then put in place , what I call a gutter. Rocks were placed around this gutter along with a moisture barrier and then concrete poured on top. Supposedly, they put holes into each concrete block on my wall and place  a pipe that goes from block to gutter. As you know, these blocks have cylinders inside where water can build up. The purpose is for water to drain from block(my wall)into the gutter then it’s to flow to corner of house where there is a sump pump.

Short story is that it’s been two years and no water has touched the sump pump. As you know the last two years have been like northwest Washington where we are getting tons of rain. Now I’m having moisture, called efflorescence, coming up where they jackhammered. AFS came by several times and put a sealer on floor. Never worked. Had another man come by and look at system to see if water was flowing properly; it was. I spoke to one of the managers and he stated there was nothing else they could do. I thought about legal action but statue of limitations had expired. $13k pretty much wasted and I’m left still trying to fix the problem.

resp.text:
Mr. Simmons,

We are sorry for your  frustration.  Making sure there is no confusion or frustration with any of our customers is vitally important to us.  We have a full time Service Department and Customer Care Club that serves no other purpose than to take care of our existing customers which you referenced with our previous visits to your home. That is something we put a lot of focus on.  If we miss you then please call us back but do look out for our call so that we can address your concern.

He walked us through videos showing the repair steps and why everything was being done.

He did so much that I cant really write it all. I could genuinely see that David truly cared about us and our situation and that has made this process so much easier knowing there is someone to help us. He has been in contact even after he left offering any help or advice needed.

This was 10x better than I ever expected. AFS is the real deal. Ill never call anyone else.

name: Ben Milam
text:
AFS Review

Before you read the rest of this, please know UPFRONT that the AFS rep notified us that they PRICE MATCH!  We found this out after we notified them we had a quote from another company.  This should throw up major “red flags” to anyone reading this. Why not give you their best price up front? Now read the rest if you would like.

Stay away from AFS if you plan on getting multiple quotes.  I LOVED everything they told me and was completely impressed by their upfront professionalism.  The representative came out, did a thorough inspection and gave us a detailed layout of what needed to be done.  Where things went bad was when it was discovered that we also had another company come out, providing comparable services for a moderately better price.  As a decent human, I felt it important to contact the AFS rep to inform him of our appreciation but we were going to go with a competitor. At that point he became a high-pressured salesman and became somewhat belligerent.  To top things off, we had filed a coverable insurance claim regarding a busted drain pipe and the insurance company contacted this AFS rep and the rep told them the problem was due to an issue that is well-known not coverable by insurance.  Had I not called the rep to inform him, man-to-man, of our decision and simply “ghosted” him (a cowardly way of handling things), we wouldn’t be in the predicament.  Through this behavior and revengeful tactics, he reassured us that AFS is not the type of company we want to take care of our home.  My wife and I are teachers and work on a limited budget...we would be silly to not request more than one estimate for a job this size.  A company such as this should realize that.

resp.text:
Mr. Milam,

We appreciate your kind remarks regarding the professionalism of our inspector.  We do try to be extremely detailed and responsible with both our inspections and repair plans.  Obviously we are disappointed when a homeowner chooses to use another company, but always want folks to make a decision that they’re comfortable with.

It sounds like there was some confusion regarding a possible insurance claim that you filed.  When asked by homeowners whether a crawlspace scenario is covered by insurance, our standard reply is that ‘it depends on your policy, it’s best to contract your insurance provider’.  While we’re not an insurance company, the trend that we have seen is that acute issues like a plumbing leak may be covered, whereas issues that develop over time, like ground water seepage are typically the homeowner’s responsibility – similar to hail damage to a roof vs a roof just wearing out.

The inspection photos of your crawl space showed a pattern of mud lines on multiple walls of your crawlspace.  This is consistent with a ground water seepage challenge and why our repair plan called for drainage and a sump pump in your crawl space.  If asked what was found in our inspection, our policy is just to be candid.  We can’t really speak to causality, but just to current conditions noted.

Hope this clears up any misunderstanding and we wish you the best with your repairs.

We are pleased to know that James, Andres, Alejandro and Sergio exceeded your expectations throughout the duration of this project. We are especially glad we were able to help restore your property. Thanks again for your business and for your review.

text: AFS has been so good to my family! Stephen Wilson was so helpful and kind. He broke everything down for us and made sure we understood it all. Highly recommend him! Very pleased!

name: Robin Wiggins
text: Our crew members Gavin Denny, Foreman and Brandon Lapp raised both our outdoor patio and a section of our garage floor using the SettleStop concrete raising polyurethane process. They were both extremely professional, knowledgeable about their product and the service they were providing. They answered all of our questions and worked very well together as a team. We highly recommend Gavin and Brandon to anyone interested in this service!

name: Gary Pugh
text: We purchased an older home that had foundation problems that led to cracking brick and a sinking garage floor.  After researching companies that dealt with this sort of problem we called AFS.  It was a great decision.  From our initial contact to the completion of the job we dealt with professional, friendly people who always had time to answer all our questions.  Our AFS inspector Tom Bewley is great.  In spite of being very busy he always made us feel like we were important to him and made sure we knew exactly what was going on.  The repairs took two crews.  The first crew led by Luis G, working with Michael Moseley and Richard Warner installed the piers to stop the settling.  They did great work, never slowed down in spite of the rain that made a mess of everything, were always friendly and open to questions, and cleaned up the muddy mess better than I ever hoped for.  A great team of professionals.  The second team led by Gavin Dendy installed the SettleStop foam to raise the garage floor back up and stabilize it.  It was amazing to watch and they made it look effortless.  Gavin explained the process and made sure we understood and were satisfied before wrapping up and leaving.  They also cleaned up after themselves and left the garage floor cleaner than it was when they got here.  I am completely satisfied with the work they did and would recommend them to anyone who has this sort of problem.  Great work guys!

resp.text: Mr. Pugh, thank you so much for this wonderful feedback! We are very happy to hear you had a great experience, from the first call to the completed installation of the piers and concrete raising. If we can do anything else for you going forward, please feel free to contact us.

name: Michael Walker
text: A trustworthy and honest company! AFS is an extremely professional company and they have definitely won our trust. We called AFS in order to have them give us an estimate for our sun room that had water leaking into the bricks. Joseph came out yesterday and took a look at our issues. He was very kind and courteous to my wife and I and took a lot of his time to explain everything in detail. The best part of the experience was his honesty. He stated that the system they use might not be the best fit for our situation. He did say that the system would definitely work but another option might be better. This kind of  honesty is quite rare with most companies. Many contractors will promise you the world but they cannot deliver. I appreciate AFS’s honesty and assistance they have provided. Although I haven’t had any work done at this point I am leaving my review based off the experience we had with the company. Even though we didn’t hire them we will use this company for any other foundation related issues in the future. Thank you.

resp.text: Mr. Walker, thank you for taking the time to review our company based on your experience with us. We take pride in providing thorough inspections and providing clear and honest reports. We appreciate you reaching out to us and allowing us to provide an expert opinion. Thanks for the opportunity.

name: Melissa Nelson
text: We have been greatly satisfied with the work of AFS! The crew who came out for us was always on time, very professional and knowledgeable about the job to be done. name: Curtis Ballard
text:
I do not write reviews and do not like people who complain; however, I cannot stress enough how poorly this company performs their work.

I called them to fix 2 drainage problems; going out the back door of my house and the other was my driveway.  When it rained the water would not drain properly in both of these locations.  AFS said that their injection program would fix both of these problems; in reality it was the start of making things much worse.  They drill a bunch of holes in the concrete and inject some material that is supposed to raise the concrete; unfortunately the whole concept is flawed.  They cannot control where this material goes as it is injected under the concrete and they are unable to correctly monitor the pressure as it goes in.  AS a result my walkway in back and my driveway ended up cracked and tilted in such a way that the problem was much worse; the water was now more directed towards my house.
AFS tried to fix the driveway by cutting a 25 foot trench in my driveway and installing a drain; unfortunately this was also done incorrectly.  The slope of the drain did not allow the water to drain out, the drain was installed with large screws going into the drain pipe, which caught leaves creating a barrier.  Additionally, the cracks they created in the driveway and improper injection of the filler material caused my driveway to sag creating a lake that does not drain at all.
AFS tried to fix the drainage problem made worse by their injection program in back by digging up part of the walkway and replacing the concrete; unfortunately, again they did not get it right.  They did not provide the proper slope to the new concrete and as a result the water make another lake immediately up against the side of my house.
So now I have worse drainage problems, my driveway looks like hell and as a result of the drainage problems the corner of my house at the garage is sagging.
I would have been much better off if they had done nothing.

resp.text: Hello Mr. Ballard, we can certainly understand your frustrations.  We are normally known for providing the most professional installations and exceptional attention to detail.  However, we regret that we missed the mark.  I’m aware that our General Manager has reached out and set up a visit with you for this Monday to address your concerns.  We thank you for the opportunity to make this right.  Have a great day Mr. Ballard.

name: John Davis
text: Very dissatisfied with the whole experience.  Had them sand blast the floor joists.  Coverage was so bad, I had to call them back and the still didn't get everything.  Also, when they removed the HVAC main duct to sand blast, which was originally suspended with metal straps, they reinstalled it using vinyl straps (and apparently not enough of them).  The weight of the main broke the straps within the first year, and the entire main is lying on the ground.  I'm appalled that they want to charge me hundreds of dollars to fix their own negligence.  I'd expect much better quality of service after spending $16,000

resp.text: Hey John, would you mind emailing your contact information to info@afsrepair.com?  We want to address this but are having difficulty pulling your information up.

text: Nothing but pain dealing with this company.  I had to do all of the initial leg work, getting the salesman to call me back, make a quote, calling in every time - not one callback from anyone, not being listened to at all.  I had put down a deposit on some work - after the schedule date was changed without my knowledge (no one knows how that happened) I decided to cancel the work since I can't trust them.  The salesman said I would get my deposit back - no confirmation, nothing from the company at all.  I called in, shows nothing about any return of deposit.  I get the "someone will call you back" but no one ever does.  Stay far far away from this company, I'm sorry I tried to do business with them.

name: Jackie Campbell
text:
My husband and I were very concerned when our home began developing cracks in the sheet-rock.  It began slowly and over the years several cracks developed throughout our home.  We knew we needed to get something done to stabilize our foundation since our home is built on clay soil with a high-water table. I googled and researched different companies and contacted AFS along with others to come out and give us an estimate.  AFS proved to be the most dependable and reliable; AFS actually showed up on the date and time they were scheduled.  Michael Rosewarne was our certified foundation repair specialist.  He was excellent.  I was very impressed with Michael's knowledge and ability to make me understand what was going on with our home.  He showed me pictures and drew a diagram of what we needed for repair; he was very thorough.  He is a super nice person and is an amazing communicator.  Even after the fact, I called him, and he was very gracious, patient, and kind to walk me through activating my account with Greensky.   Our foundation repair team arrived as scheduled calling along the way to let us know their ETA.  Matt Fernandes and his crew were fantastic, super friendly, honest, and very respectful.  Matt explained everything he and his team would be doing.  Matt showed me pictures of everything they had done.  They did a superb job working diligently until they got the job exactly as it should be.  They left everything neat and in order.  I think most of the cracks in our home are already closing.  Kudos to Matt and his team.  Michael also contacted me after the work was completed making sure we were happy with the results.
AFS is clearly a great company known for its integrity because of the great people working for them, Michael Rosewarne and Matt Fernandes along with his team.

resp.text: Jackie, thank you for taking the time to write this detailed review! We are glad you had such a good experience from beginning to end with AFS! Please let us know if we can be of any further assistance going forward.

I hope that anyone who needs help will call and speak to her.  Thanks!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, April. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your interaction with our team member Jennifer—and we agree, Jenn is truly an asset to our team and we are happy to have her!

name: Bruce Bentley
text: Put supports under my house, left a big mess under and outside of house. Called to come back and fix issues, they came back but before they left told me not to ever call them back. They do not stand begin their work. I still have problems with my floor. When you hear Afs run away as fast as you can.

resp.text: Mr. Bentley, we have responded to your concerns each time you have reached out since your original floor support installation June 2012. Our company has sent certified inspectors and crew members to your home and provided a thorough inspection of your floors, finding that they are indeed stabilized. We last reached out in 2017, offering to send a manager out to inspect the floors but you did not respond to our calls and voicemails. Although you have not responded to us reaching out, we are more than happy to come look at your floors, at no charge, even though your warranty expired in 2014. We absolutely stand behind our work and can be reached at 877-340-8479.

name: Larry G Hill Jr
text:
First, I will say that the crew was professional, efficient and did an excellent job. 5 stars for the crew. The Inspector/salesman was knowledgeable and made a sales pitch, but it lacked a few details. Like telling me someone had to be present on the 1st day during the soda blasting because they needed access to the inside of the house. The whole process seemed well coordinated for them. But, well-coordinated for them doesn’t necessarily mean well-coordinated for me and I felt they were partially responsible for that due to the lack of key information and poor initial inspection. I'd give 2.5 stars if I could

When I signed up, I thought I signed up for a thorough crawlspace inspection. What my Inspector did was gather just enough information about my crawlspace to fit into his sales pitch. It’s probably best to do your own crawlspace inspection before you even call them out, because you may have to perform repairs before their crew comes out. They DO NOT employ plumbers, carpenters or electricians to handle possible crawlspace issues. They just want to sell you their system and once you sign that contract you can’t back out without paying a 15% restocking fee.

After the Inspector performed his inspection at my place, I found and had to deal with several issues. In accordance with the contract I was responsible for making sure there was power available in the crawlspace for the dehumidifier. When I go into the crawlspace to take care of this I see a wet spot from 15 feet away and realize I have a water leak. A closer look revealed I had water damage. I point blank asked that Inspector if he saw anything that required immediate attention and he said “No”. There’s no way he should have missed this. The “Inspector” did come out and look at it and he did put me in touch with a carpenter, whom I did use, and I was able to get a plumber out quickly. But, with the expense of these repairs I would have liked to have pushed out the AFS work just to let my pocket book recover and make paying for the AFS work a little less taxing. He seemed to balk at the suggestion.

Back to the power I was installing. I asked specific questions about the dehumidifier they were going to install. Where did they need power? How long is the cord for the dehumidifier? What type of plug? Etc… What he didn’t tell me was they needed 2 outlets for the job. I assumed 1 spot to plug in the dehumidifier would be sufficient, so I cleaned up an existing power connection for the sump pump in my crawlspace, making sure to leave them a spot to plug in the dehumidifier. When the crew came out on the first day they informed me they need a 2nd outlet for the pump that goes with the dehumidifier, so I’m left scrambling that night to install another outlet.

It turned out I also had a strange issue with my AC ductwork that the AFS crew reported to me on the 1st day. I’ll give the Inspector a break here and say he may or may not have discovered this if he had performed the type of inspection I expected. This turned into yet another unexpected expense on top of the carpenter and plumber. It would have been nice if the Inspector had caught all of this. I would have preferred to take care of these 3 major issues before scheduling AFS. They still would have got my business, it just would have been pushed out a month or so. The experience just left a few things to be desired. Time will tell if the work holds up.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Hill, we would like to thank you for giving our installation crew a 5 star rating.  However, we would like to apologize for your negative experience with the inspector’s initial visit.  We have a high standard of quality for providing a complete and thorough inspection, and your home should not have been an exception.  We would like the opportunity to discuss this further with you.  Please call 256-880-0670 to speak with our General Manager, we will reach out to you as well.  Thank you Mr. Hill, and have a great day.

text: AFS has done a great job on our 70 year old house several times! Dan Gordon and Gavin did a fabulous job making sure all went well! I appreciate their help and professionalism over the years!

We value you as a customer and appreciate your trust in our company. Michael is a great Inspector with years of experience and we are glad that he continues to provide you with great service. Francisco, Jordan and Javier work extremely hard to provide the best installation and we appreciate the great feedback on their work. Thank you again Ann for choosing AFS.

I point blank asked that Inspector if he saw anything that required immediate attention and he said “No”. There’s no way he should have missed this. The “Inspector” did come out and look at it and he did put me in touch with a carpenter, whom I did use, and I was able to get a plumber out quickly. But, with the expense of these repairs I would have liked to have pushed out the AFS work just to let my pocket book recover and make paying for the AFS work a little less taxing. He seemed to balk at the suggestion.

Back to the power I was installing. I asked specific questions about the dehumidifier they were going to install. Where did they need power? How long is the cord for the dehumidifier? What type of plug? Etc… What he didn’t tell me was they needed 2 outlets for the job. I assumed 1 spot to plug in the dehumidifier would be sufficient, so I cleaned up an existing power connection for the sump pump in my crawlspace, making sure to leave them a spot to plug in the dehumidifier. When the crew came out on the first day they informed me they need a 2nd outlet for the pump that goes with the dehumidifier, so I’m left scrambling that night to install another outlet.

It turned out I also had a strange issue with my AC ductwork that the AFS crew reported to me on the 1st day. I’ll give the Inspector a break here and say he may or may not have discovered this if he had performed the type of inspection I expected. This turned into yet another unexpected expense on top of the carpenter and plumber. It would have been nice if the Inspector had caught all of this. I would have preferred to take care of these 3 major issues before scheduling AFS. They still would have got my business, it just would have been pushed out a month or so. The experience just left a few things to be desired. Time will tell if the work holds up.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Hill, we would like to thank you for giving our installation crew a 5 star rating.  However, we would like to apologize for your negative experience with the inspector’s initial visit.  We have a high standard of quality for providing a complete and thorough inspection, and your home should not have been an exception.  We would like the opportunity to discuss this further with you.  Please call 256-880-0670 to speak with our General Manager, we will reach out to you as well.  Thank you Mr. Hill, and have a great day.

text:
I contacted AFS not knowing much about the company, except what I was exposed to on TV and the internet. I needed work done on my house foundation and my son-in-law of Huntsville Heating and cooling, Christopher Hayden said that he had heard the company did good work.
David Rathmann of AFS responded to my call and we discussed what needed to be done and he explained the ins and outs of how it could be done and then let me make the decision on what I thought I needed and he made suggestions along the way. So it was decided I would have the work done.
On the two days the pier crew arrived, the crew chief Javier greeted me and we discussed the work progress and what they were doing each day.  Javier was ready to explain anything I was unsure about, with a short discussion on my expectations he and his crew was ready to get started. I have been around crews, and know how hard it is to get everyone going but without hesitation the crew was assigned work and they really got started. Along the way as I watched each of the crew was ready to explain what they were doing and why. It was great to see a crew that was self starting and knew their job so it could be accomplished with little delay. The second day the crew members changed a bit, but still  Javier was the crew chief, and again they started work soon after they arrived without delay and some conversations occurred at times to make sure what they were doing was the right way, because the situation of this repair was a little unusual, but they adapted to keep the work on time and with a professional attitude.
The third day the poly crew chief,  Dendy and crew arrived on time and immediately Dendy greeted me and explained what they were here for and ask to be shown the work area.  We discussed what he was going to do and how it would be accomplished and without delay, they got started preparing for the job of the day. They were always willing to explain the procedure and the expected results, and also how they would attempt to prevent any unwanted results.
I want to commend all the personnel for their excellent work and their professionalism and accepting my sometimes unneeded suggestions and allowing me to express myself.
Thank you AFS for having happy crews, apparently they like working for AFS and proudly say so with a strong sense of belonging to a company who apparently cares about their employees.

Robert Hendrix
A  Satisfied Customer.

name: Don Bari
text:
Once you read my recent experience with ECO-Three of AL, you will select them ASAP.  I live in Pensacola FL and felt that my 3700 sq ft house (10 years old) needed a little insulation (top-off)  help.

So I got the usual 3 estimates and heard the analysis and sales pitch of each, and evaluated each of them as a Chemical Engineer, that I am.

The summary is that two of the three Contractors gave me a over-sell pitch of everything that that I needed (which I knew that I didn't need).  Only Walker Goodrich of ECO -three gave me that real pitch and actually-talked me out of unnecessary work when I pitched to Walker what the other contractors said I needed.

The bottom line ( literally) was that Eco-Three quoted $2850 for the job,, while the other two contractors quoted about $12,000 and $8,000, respectively.

Once I awarded the Contract to Eco-three, they did what they promised and when they said they would do it, and in a very neat way.

Starting the day of instillation Feb 24 2018, my average daily electricity usage dropped 33%  (for equivalent outside temperature highs and lows) relative to before the insulation was added.

Another  energy saving tip is to replace your AC single-speed pool pump motor with a low energy (variable speed) pump motor.  I did it last year for $800 installed and with it on 8 hours per day, everyday, my power consumption cost just for the pump dropped abut $100-$125 per month.

I hope that this helps

Don B
